Package com.zodoto.util.ducks

Distributed Unique Common Key System (DUCKS)

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DuckControl
    Describes the central controller for a duck key source.
    DuckLog
    Describes a simple logger to events such as requests, responses, and any errors.
    DuckPersist
    Persists Duck Map to permanent storage
    DuckSecurity
    Encrypts and decrypts request and response messages
    DuckSource
    Used by a Duck Controller to contact a source Duck for another key range
    DuckSourceRemote
    Connection to the remote server
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DuckConfiguration
    Contains the configuration settings for a duck
    DuckConfigurationFileLoader
    Loads the configuration from the file
    DuckConstants
    Constants
    DuckControlService
    This class is the core of the duck.
    DuckControlServiceTest  
    DuckData
    Contains the record for persistence
    DuckEgg
    Container for a named key, keeps the current range, and an on-deck range
    DuckEggTest  
    DuckFinal
    Non-thread safe duck.
    DuckLocal
    Thread safe class that is intended to live within a JVM It doesn't persist the keys, which sacrifices persistence for speed Each restart gets a new set of keys and loses any still in the cache
    DuckLogBase  
    DuckLogFile
    Writes log messages to a file Rolls over the log files each day
    DuckLogNoOp
    Logger that silently discards messages
    DuckLogSysout  
    DuckLogTest  
    DuckMaker
    Creates a source, persist, and control using the configuration.
    DuckPersistFile
    Saves the current working state to a file.
    DuckPersistMock  
    DuckPersistNoOp
    Implementation of DuckPersist that doesn't save any thing, and returns an empty list on getAll.
    DuckRange
    Response from a duck with the key range If a Duck is out of keys it will request one from its source The time to reply exceeds a configured setting then the requester times out.
    DuckRequest
    Request for set of keys RequestedSize is the maximum key size.
    DuckSecurityPublicPrivate
    Encrypt / Decrypt
    DuckServer
    Entry point to a duck server, which can be either the source of the keys or a relay that holds sets of keys to be distributed.
    DuckSocketListener
    Listens for a socket connection, which will have a request for a set of keys.
    DuckSocketThread
    Receives a single request, contacts the local control for the next set of keys, and returns them
    DuckSourceControl
    Controller for the request to the source
    DuckSourceMaster
    Source to be used by the Super Duck.
    DuckSourceMock  
    DuckSourceRemoteSocket
    Sends request to and receives response from another server using a simple TCP socket connection
    DuckSourceThread
    Querying another duck is delegated to a separate thread so that the requesting code doesn't block This class makes use of another class to do the communication, so that different means (socket, http, message queue, etc can be used)
    SampleSuper  
    SimpleLocal  
    SimpleRelay  
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    DuckStatus
    Status of a request response Success: Worked, we have a key range Empty: We have no keys Timeout: Ran out of time waiting response Failure: Error occurred trying to get a key range
    DuckType
    Type of duck FINAL, returns single key only,not thread sage, no persistence, gets keys from local LOCAL, returns key range, thread safe, by default no persistence, gets keys from relay or super RELAY, returns key range, stand alone, listens on port, has persistence, gets keys from relay or super SUPER returns key range, stand alone, listens on port, must have persistence, generates keys locally, only one

Package com.zodoto.util.ducks Description

Distributed Unique Common Key System (DUCKS)
Author:
Pete Guard
